properties.address: 1-3 Bitton Park Road,, Teignmouth, devon TQ14 9BT TQ14 9BT
properties.description: Come along to our community café here at the Alice Cross Centre every Thursday from 1.30pm - 4pm and Every Saturday 08.30 - 12pm Our café offers delicious home cooked, nutritious meals and light bites, snacks, cakes and hot drinks. Open to all! There is no need to book. Food is offered on a pay-what-you-can or donation basis.
properties.title: Community Cafe

properties.address: EDDC Community Centre, Exmouth, Devon EX8 3AQ
properties.description: A warm welcome and a warm space is offered in our community centre. We provide free home cooked lunches, hot drinks, snacks, daily papers, magazines and games. You will also be able to pick up information and attend weekly activities and workshops. We welcome all ideas and help to make each space even more inviting and welcoming.
properties.title: Community Hub

properties.address: Church Street, Exmouth, Devon EX8 1PE
properties.description: Our Community Cafe provides a safe, warm and welcoming space Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays for all age groups. We provide low-cost and free meals for those in need, a Community Fridge and Baby Bank. We have support workers available in the mornings who can offer support and advice. We have on-site showers, laundry facilities and clothes to anyone who finds themselves homeless. On Tuesday mornings we run a Craft Room for anyone interested in learning or sharing craft skills in a friendly group environment. Term time on Thursday mornings we run a Parent Hub Cafe providing a welcoming and supportive space for parents and children. The Baby Bank and Community Fridge is available during these sessions.
properties.title: Community Hub

properties.address: Morgan Court Community Centre, Exmouth, Devon EX8 2AD
properties.description: A warm and safe space open to anyone who lives in East Devon where you can get a hot meal, drinks and snacks. You can make friends, meet new neighbours, or sit quietly if you prefer. We run craft and art activities, have cooking demonstrations and benefits surgeries. You can access council services and talk about any issues you may have. We play games, have silly competitions and look after each other. we are open all year and all meals and activities are FREE!
properties.title: EDDC Community Hub

properties.address: Churchill Court Community Centre, Exmouth, Devon EX8 5JB
properties.description: A warm safe space for everyone who lives in East Devon to enjoy. We provide a hot meal every session along with drinks and snacks, daily newspapers and magazines. We play games and make things, we have regular craft workshops but also budgeting advice, help accessing benefits and access to council services. There is always a warm welcome whether you want to join in, make friends, meet your neighbours or just want to sit and be quiet – we will welcome you. All activities and meals are free, including a Christmas dinner and Diwali feast!
properties.title: EDDC Community Hub

properties.address: Exminster Methodist Church, Devon EX6 8BT
properties.description: The hall is open to all for monthly coffee mornings which are free and include a book stall. Coffee mornings are usually held on the third or fourth Saturday each month between 10.30 am and 12 noon.
properties.title: Exminster Methodist Church

properties.address: All Saints CHURCH EXMOUTH, Devon EX8 1RZ
properties.description: Three years ago Stephen moved from Plymouth to Exmouth and saw a call out in the local paper for someone to run the local stroke survivors’ club. He applied and got the role. ‍ Stephen is a Christian and says he tries to support others from all different backgrounds “because I’ve been there himself”. I don’t ask what he means by that, but he does later say he’s had several strokes and TIAs. ‍ Initially, the group met in Exmouth Pavillion; then they used a council building. More recently, they’ve been using All Saints’ Church in Exmouth. The church hall is open two days a week until 3pm as a Warm Welcome Space. (Stephen calls it a Warm Hub.) Exmouth Stroke Survivors' Club space visitor ‍ “We felt sometimes people wanted it for longer so now people can come back from 6pm or 7pm. We have some entertainment. We’ve had Elvis nights and all sorts,” says Stephen. ‍ “We get food donated from Tesco and Marks & Spencer each week which we use for meals,” says Stephen. Other food donations go to people in the community who can use it. Volunteers at the Exmouth Stroke Survivors' Club ‍ On a Monday and a Wednesday, the Stroke Survivors’ Club gives a dinner, “at dinnertime”. The Club also delivers food parcels to people who can’t come to the meetings for whatever reason, charging a nominal £3 for delivery (waived for those who really can’t pay). ‍ Sometimes, club members check on others and offer advice, for instance on energy saving and payments. “People say thank you, if it wasn’t for you I wouldn’t know what to do,” says Stephen, unassumingly. ‍ Funding has been an issue, but the Survivors’ Club charges a yearly subscription and they have held several fundraising events including a quiz and a gardening activity for which they were donated plants and soil. Sport England even gave them a table tennis table. ‍ And that’s not it: the Club teaches cookery skills to people on low incomes or those who’ve had strokes, showing them how to use vegetables and what they might have in the kitchen cupboard. ‍ “I want to make sure people feel looked after,” says Stephen. Mothers' Day montage ‍ The Club has grown from five or six people three years ago, to 75 club members today. It really is the most fantastic example of a space serving its community –
properties.title: Exmouth stroke survivors club community

properties.address: The Estuary League Of Friends, Devon EX3 0DX
properties.description: The space is open to all 2pm till 3.30 pm Mon - Fri . Free Soup & Roll or Tea & Coffee, Free Wifi and access to ipads. Childrens games and play items available

properties.title: St James Tuesdays Popup Cafe

properties.address: St Margaret's Church, Topsham, Exeter EX3 0HL
properties.description: The space is open to all, with facilities to make hot drinks, have a biscuit and read a book. Children and young people are more than welcome too, with a guardian. There is lots and lots of neutral toys, activities and games to occupy them.
properties.title: St Margaret's Church

properties.address: Strand Community Centre, Dawlish, Devon EX7 9PT
properties.description: The Strand Centre is a community centre on the main high street in Dawlish, run by the Strand Community Trust. The centre comprises the Inspire Café, a large Auditorium, and several smaller rooms. We are a registered Place of Welcome within the community. The centre is a warm space for people to find respite and quiet, as well as to engage with others in the community. There are a series of programmed events, including groups such as a weekly Age Concern UK lunch club, the Men’s Shed, toddler groups, and a group for those with special educational needs. A street chapel is available for those who wish to engage in quiet reflection away from the main centre activities. The manager and volunteers are sensitive to the diverse needs of centre users, and will talk especially with those who are alone to see if they require specific provision or just some friendly conversation and a listening ear. Centre users can stay as long as they like throughout the opening hours with no pressure to purchase food or drinks. Homeless individuals use the centre to obtain respite, receive free refreshments, and receive clothing, bedding and food parcels. Many of our centre users are older people who find comfort and friendship during their regular visits.
properties.title: Strand Community Centre

properties.address: The Old Gospel Hall, Exmouth, Devon EX8 2LT
properties.description: We are open to the whole community, drop in any time and stay for as long or short a time as you like. Hot drinks and biscuits are available throughout the afternoon. Toys are available for pre-schoolers and board games/cards/puzzles/chat (or simply sit and be) for adults.
properties.title: The Old Gospel Hall

properties.address: Westbank Community Health and Care, Exeter, Devon EX6 8AT
properties.description: Pop in for a warm welcome and enjoy warm food and drinks in a safe, comfortable and cosy space, where you will also have the opportunity to socialise with other members of the community, as well as receive support and advice on keeping warm, eating healthily and staying well this winter.
properties.title: Warmwell at Westbank

properties.address: Wesleys, Devon EX9 6NH
properties.description: Wesley's is a community cafe open to all. As well as serving hot and cold drinks, delicious snacks and meals and homemade cakes and scones, we also run an activity programme, workshops and lunch clubs. Wesley's also hosts the Budleigh Communty Larder.
properties.title: Wesley's Community Cafe and Space

properties.address: Wonford Methodist Church, Exeter, Devon EX2 6NG
properties.description: Wonford Welcome is open to all. There are free refreshments and free activities such as board games, quizzes, colouring or you can browse the Book Nook
